meanings.definition: Aniseikonias: a condition in which the two eyes have unequal image sizes
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with aniseikonias after noticing the difference in image sizes between their eyes.
meanings.sent2: Aniseikonias can make it challenging to perceive depth accurately.
meanings.sent3: At the eye doctor's office, the aniseikonias in the patient's eyes caused quite a spectacle.
meanings.sent4: Her aniseikonias was like looking through two different lenses of a pair of binoculars.
meanings.sent5: The aniseikonias in his eyes made the world seem like a funhouse mirror maze.

meanings.definition: Aniseikonias: the presence of unequal magnification in the two eyes
meanings.sent1: The optometrist explained that aniseikonias could lead to difficulties in focusing.
meanings.sent2: Aniseikonias may require corrective lenses to help balance vision.
meanings.sent3: The aniseikonias in her eyes made her feel like she was wearing 3D glasses all the time.
meanings.sent4: His aniseikonias was as noticeable as wearing glasses with one clear lens and one blurry lens.
meanings.sent5: The aniseikonias made everything in his field of vision seem like a distorted painting.
